title: KartRocket Launches India’s First Mobile C2C Marketplace: “Kraftly”
text:
NEW DELHI, September 28th, 2015 - Kartrocket launches Kraftly - India's first C2C mobile marketplace for unique and hand crafted products, which so far have been available largely offline. These items cover a wide range, including art, home & living, apparel, fashion accessories, costume jewelry, craft supplies, food, bath and beauty products, toys and unique products. The app follows a model of an open marketplace which allows any seller – online or offline – to create their “microshop” in seconds and start selling. Buyers are able to discover unique products in a personalized manner and directly interact with sellers.
“There are over 50M homepreneurs, artisans and flea market sellers that currently have no avenue to sell online except for unorganized channels such as WhatsApp and Facebook. Further, a large number of consumers have no place to discover such eclectic products except in an offline setting. Kraftly wants to become the one-stop shop to cater to both these audiences.” comments Saahil Goel, CEO of Kraftly.
Currently available options, allow small and hobby sellers to only sell through platforms such as classified listings. However, this doesn’t address the fundamental problem associated with commerce – which is payments and shipping. Kraftly addresses these issues and offers a complete buying and selling experience that truly makes it the first C2C marketplace of India. The app enables any individual, hobby seller or shop owner to create their own branded micro-shop, list products and receive payments on the go – without requiring any paperwork. Kraftly completely manages payments and logistics for each seller thereby allowing the long tail of small and home sellers to go online.
Kraftly pioneers a unique wallet system that allows buyers to directly deposit payments into the sellers wallet making the transaction extremely transparent. Shop owners can also use the app as a “point of sale” system for walk-in customers and use it for accepting credit and debit cards in their shops instantly by signing up on the app.
“The current ecommerce ecosystem is primarily geared up for B2C commerce with a strong focus on standardized products sold through a small set of distributors and suppliers. Small sellers make up a large part of offline retail, yet are unable to sell with the large marketplaces. On-boarding a seller onto B2C marketplaces is a tedious process that only a few small sellers will ever want to undertake. Further, marketplaces have huge barriers such as – photo shoot quality, minimum number of products required, product specifications and documentation that further have prevented this seller community to launch online. With a strong focus on promoting small sellers, Kraftly allows users to simply click pictures of their products and completely manage their microshop – all from their smartphones.” added Saahil.
Until now, it was difficult to reach small sellers, but with the explosion of the smartphone market in India, the dynamics are in favor. For a lot of these sellers, introduction to the Internet has been through the smartphone making it the first medium to get online. The listing process on Kraftly is as simple as adding a picture to Facebook or WhatsApp.
As ecommerce continues to boom in India (projected at 15x growth in 5 years), consumers will demand such artsy and eclectic products through the online channel as well. Currently access to these products is limited to offline exhibitions and craft fairs and has a limited consumer reach.
To enhance user experience for buyers in certain categories such as – food items, home décor, bulky goods and plants, Kraftly also allows users to search and browse for products using location as a filter.
By bringing a large supply of un-standard products online, Kraftly will become a one stop mobile app to shop for unique, quirky and trendy products across categories. Since products are being listed directly by the creator, prices will also be relatively cheaper than what consumers are used to paying. This makes Kraftly a win-win situation for both the seller and the buyer.
“Our unique model allows us to represent the seller and create a venue for sellers to easily conduct business with convenience. We strongly support the small seller community and have planned several initiatives around the same in the coming year. Currently we have over 1500 category leaf nodes and over 6 lac products from 2000+ sellers for a buyer to choose from. We expect that in 6 months we will have over 5 Lac sellers on the platform and have close to 30-40 Lac SKUs” adds Saahil Goel.
TOP 10 FEATURES THAT MAKE KRAFTLY A MUST HAVE APP
1. Unique & Quirky Products: Kraftly is your one stop shop for products and categories that you won’t be able to find anywhere else. You will always be pleasantly surprised with what you find on Kraftly.
2. Ease of Listing: To list your products, you just need to click a picture from your mobile, upload details and start selling. You don’t need to fill-up long forms, wait in queue, get photo-shoot done, etc.
3. Micro-shop: Every seller who lists products on Kraftly gets a micro-shop with it. This is their handle on Kraftly & they can easily use it to showcase their collections to potential buyers and sell from it.
4. Whatsapp Commerce: A seller can sell directly to their contacts from the app through Whatsapp and actually collect payments as well instead of collecting payments in an unorganized manner. Kraftly doesn’t charge any commission on orders placed through Whatsapp which makes it even better for the seller
5. Payments: A seller now can instantly collect payments through KartRocket wallet free of any costs instead of first applying for a payment gateway that is not even a possibility if you don’t have sufficient documents.
6. Shipping: Using pre-integrated courier companies, a seller can ship its orders without any hassles from the mobile phone itself.
7. Direct Buyer & Seller Interaction: The app creates direct link between the seller and the buyer that builds trust and transparency that is of utmost importance for a C2C app to succeed.
8. Low Commission %: We charge only 5% on the orders that a seller receives through Kraftly.
9. Local SEO and listing on Google: We create a local Google listing for every shop that registers with Kraftly. This gives the seller an organic presence on Google which
10. Upgrade to a fully functional website: When a seller sees growth and wants their own website, they can easily migrate everything to their website on KartRocket from the app.
“With Kraftly we intend to change how C2C transactions work in India. The initial response to the app has been tremendous. We have been listed in ‘Trending’, ‘Top New Free’ categories already in Google play store; have signed up 2000+ sellers in a week of its launch. Currently the app is available only for android users with iOS coming out in the next 7-10 days.” adds Saahil Goel.

About Kraftly:
Kraftly ( www.kraftly.com ) is a mobile enabled C2C marketplace for selling and buying unique and un-standardized products. Kraftly allows small sellers to launch a microshop on the app in seconds and take their business online. With fully managed payments and logistics, Kraftly solves a fundamental problem for small sellers. By using the smartphone as the primary medium for cataloging, it envisions making a large base of offline products accessible to consumers online. It has features such as WhatsApp and Facebook selling which allow sellers to directly sell to their customers as well. The Kraftly product is owned by BigFoot Retail Solutions, a privately held company based in New Delhi, India and co-founded by Saahil Goel and Gautam Kapoor.
